programme.desc: Naziv serije je asocijacija na sedam glavnih likova, sedam radnika starog beogradskog hotela koji je stecište sumnjivih tipova i paravan za razne mutne poslove. Zaposleni pokušavaju da odole... Naziv serije je asocijacija na sedam glavnih likova, sedam radnika starog beogradskog hotela koji je stecište sumnjivih tipova i paravan za razne mutne poslove. Zaposleni pokušavaju da odole radoznalosti finansijske policije, a upravnik se trudi da sačuva fotelju. Uz razne zgode i nezgode, kroz hotel defiluje čitava galerija prevaranata, lažnih milionera i lovaca u mutnom.

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

credits.actor: Ksenija Pajić, Zijad Gračić, Iva Visković, Filip Juričić, Jelena Veljača, Zlatko Ožbolt, Maja Noveljić-Romčević, Nenad Stojmenović
Jelisaveta Sablić, Nikola Simić, Mirka Vasiljević, Zijah Sokolović, Marija Karan

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca,... Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca, ekspert za sva pitanja i najškrtiji gazda na svetu. Deda mu je rekao da svaki uspešan Srbin mora da ima kafanu i on je ove godine osnovao svoju. Poslove oko kafane poverio je misterioznoj Madam Žaklini koja je naše gore list, ali je ugostiteljsko znanje sticala u Parizu.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

programme.title: Pare ili život
programme.desc: "Pare ili život" prati glavne likove iz istoimene serije i njihovu nezaboravnu ljetnju avanturu u najljepšim predelima crnogorskog Primorja. "Pare ili život" je dramska, komična TV serija koja prati nekoliko različitih karaktera u sudaru s našom svakodnevnicom. Dramski realizam ove serije nekad se graniči s apsurdom, ali oslobođen je humora po svaku cenu i radije problematizuje neke socijalne fenomene. U društvu koje priželjkuje da je tranzicija već gotova, a ona tek što je počela, javljaju se brojne zamke za sve one koji se "nisu snašli". A Miki, Džoni, Višnja, Sunčica, Marun, Maja i Časlav, nisu sposobni da u novim okolnostima uspeju poput oca njihovog prijatelja Gagija. Razlozi za to nisu ni vaspitanje, ni "devedesete", ni komunizam (pa toliki zakleti komunisti veoma lako su postali uspešni kapitalisti). Na putu do uspeha smetaju im veliko srce i slab stomak. Svi njihovi poduhvati tužni su do smeha, jer je svako raspet između prevaziđenog osećanja zajedništva i želje za ličnim uspehom. Ipak, kad se u njihovim životima pojavi raspevani sanjar Džoni, počinje da se stvara jedna čudna porodica gde svi oni, hteli to ili ne, ostvaruju mnogo jače veze od onih rodbinskih. I usput dobijaju možda mnogo vredniju nagradu od one za kojom sve vreme jure.

programme.title: Ljubav u zaleđu
programme.desc: U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. Dvojica od njih napravili su profesionalne karijere kao fudbaleri, jedan je postao uspešan trener, a poslednji je u menadžerskim vodama. U mladosti, na vrhuncu karijere, jedan od mladića tragično je izgubio život, nakon čega su ostale životni putevi odveli na različite strane.Serija počinje dvadeset pet godina kasnije kad su svi ponovo u Zagrebu. Osim što ih veže fudbal i zajednička prošlost, likovi serije su i u složenim emotivnim odnosima. Paralelno se prate i životi njihove dece, koji su odrastali pod uticajem fudbala, te su često opterećeni prošlošću svojih roditelja. U središtu je ljubav dvoje mladih, fudbalera Marka Marušića i slikarke Nine Radić. Njihova ljubavna priča je puna prepreka i zapleta zbog različitih sredina i naizgled nespojivih životnih stilova.

credits.actor: Jelisaveta Sablić, Nikola Simić, Mirka Vasiljević, Zijah Sokolović, Marija Karan

programme.title: Najluđi intervju
programme.desc: Kada voditelj talk showa (James Franco) i producent (Seth Rogen) uspiju dobiti intervju s obožavateljem, sjevernokorejskim diktatorom Kim Jong-unom, CIA ih angažira da putovanje pretvore u atentat. Dave Skylark (James Franco) kralj je intervjua sa slavnim osobama i voditelj hit noćnog talk showa "Skylark večeras". Mozak iza Daveova carstva njegov je producent i najbolji prijatelj Aaron Rapoport (Seth Rogen). Neispunjeni Aaron čezne za smislenim radom. Dobije priliku života kad osigura Daveu intervju s Kim Jong-unom, tajanstvenim i okrutnim diktatorom nuklearno naoružane Sjeverne Koreje. Dok se Dave i Aaron pripremaju za odlazak u Sjevernu Koreju, obrati im se CIA i zamoli ih da izvrše atentat na Kima. Oni prihvaćaju misiju i postaju dva najnekvalificiranija čovjeka koja su ikad pokušala ubiti - ili intervjuirati - najopasnijeg čovjeka na Zemlji.

Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073850/","name":"Michael Berg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3229505/","name":"Yoni Brenner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #4","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4155684633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMTc0MDc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc5NTIyOTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzMTc0MDc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc5NTIyOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scrat's epic pursuit of his elusive acorn catapults him outside of Earth, where he accidentally sets off a series of cosmic events that transform and threaten the planet. To save themselves from peril, Manny, Sid, Diego, and the rest of the herd leave their home and embark on a quest that takes them to exotic new lands."},"datePublished":"2016-06-23","description":"When Scrat's acorn sends an asteroid to Earth, the Herd must find a way to stop the asteroid from hitting Earth with the help of a returning friend.","keywords":"meteorite,outer space,unidentified flying object,ice age,prehistoric times","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3416828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scottshak_111"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hilarious!","reviewBody":"Okay, so I will be honest. Ice Age Collision Course wasn't really needed, and we could have lived without it, unless we were driving on a stupendous plane that would have thrilled us beyond limit like Pixar movies generally do. Despite the apparent, Ice Age: Collision Course still manages to pull it off, owing to their awesome sense of snappy humour and their fascinating CGI that makes everything appear stunning.

PLOT OF ICE AGE COLLISION COURSE 

Ice Age Collision Course comes with a very banal plot. The implausibility of Ice Age keeps on degrading as we caper towards exploring new parts of the franchise. Maybe Blue Sky Studios have been milking its installments too much, so much that they are actually running out of material. No doubt there is always humour galore in their work, but at one point it becomes kind of pointless when there is nothing in their baggage and they still try to squeeze every bit to make jokes out of thin air.

The plot of Ice Age Collision Course is something as dumb as Scrat messing around with the universe. That's what he does. He keeps showing up throughout the movie to accidentally mess with the fate of the planet. Things that avalanche therefrom aren't exactly what we were expecting. It toys with everything – the story-line, the credibility, jokes, everything! 

BEST BITS TO REMEMBER 

Remember Buck? Well, the awesome weasel is here as well, and he is probably one of the best things about the movie. Simon Pegg returns to voice the one-eyed chap who will take you on a joyride to saving the planet. He is just the way we left him in the prequels. Totally loco! A side plot of Julian–Peaches story was an impending steer, which was quite thoughtful. It tried to give the story a perspective and a good direction. Granny returns once again with her incessant nagging which never bores you. Oh and we should never forget the true antihero of Ice Age franchise, Scrat who always brings hilarity to no matter what he does.

THE FINAL VERDICT 

I say the humour is way better than what the Angry Birds movie came up with. If you liked that you are definitely going to love this. If you didn't, well, you are still going to like Ice Age Collision Course for its magnificent animation and rib-tickling humour.

Read all my reviews here: http://straightfromamovie.com","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59677,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Interview
Najluđi intervju
programme.desc:
The Interview: Directed by Evan Goldberg, Seth Rogen. With James Franco, Seth Rogen, Lizzy Caplan, Randall Park. Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapaport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight". When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Jong-Un Kim, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2788710/","name":"The Interview","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMTcwMzgyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzAyMzQ2MzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1320827/","name":"Randall Park"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0345956/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1003839/","name":"Dan Sterling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1114222361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTMxNDk1Njk3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUwNjI1MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTMxNDk1Njk3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUwNjI1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapoport run the popular celebrity tabloid TV show "Skylark Tonight." When they discover that North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un is a fan of the show, they land an interview with him in an attempt to legitimize themselves as journalists. As Dave and Aaron prepare to travel to Pyongyang, their plans change when the CIA recruits them, perhaps the two least-qualified men imaginable, to assassinate Kim Jong-un."},"datePublished":"2014-12-24","description":"Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapaport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight". When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Jong-Un Kim, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him.","keywords":"finger bitten off,assassination attempt,male nudity,dictator,alternate history","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2788710/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1"},"dateCreated":"2014-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some Wicked Fun!","reviewBody":"Despite the doomed controversy surrounding it, 'The Interview' is a pretty cool & funny film, that deserved a wider release. Its limited release may restrict its appeal, but I'd suggest anyone who wants to laugh on Christmas, should check this one out. 

'The Interview' Synopsis: Dave Skylark and producer Aaron Rapoport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight." When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Un, they are recruited by the CIA to turn their trip to Pyongyang into an assassination mission.

'The Interview' has its share of hiccups. Firstly, the concept itself, would raise eye-brows & the sequences involving the dictator, are quite shocking, even though its told in all good humor. One more thing, the excessive violence in the narrative puts off you. The bloodshed could've easily been calmer.

But on the plus side, 'The Interview' is quite a joyride! Seth Rogen's Story, is nicely complimented by a mostly laugh-out-loud Screenplay Written by Dan Sterling. There are moments of pure hilarity, as well as moments involving shocking dialogue. Rogen & Evan Goldberg's Direction is perfect. Cinematography is awesome. Editing is rightly done. Art Design is excellent. 

Performance-Wise: Rogen is in very good form, delivering above expectations. James Franco is a complete riot. His over-the-top, loud performance as the self-obsessed TV-Anchor, brings the house down on numerous occasions. Lizzy Caplan is first-rate. Randall Park is another topper as the megalomaniac dictator. His scenes with Franco, are truly funny. Diana Bang is stupendous, she unknowingly steals the show!

On the whole, 'The Interview' has moments of shock & gore, but there is also a lot of humor in here, that does the trick.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":311443,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Jong-Un Kim, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him.","keywords":"finger bitten off,assassination attempt,male nudity,dictator,alternate history","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2788710/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1","dateCreated":"2014-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some Wicked Fun!","reviewBody":"Despite the doomed controversy surrounding it, 'The Interview' is a pretty cool & funny film, that deserved a wider release. Its limited release may restrict its appeal, but I'd suggest anyone who wants to laugh on Christmas, should check this one out. 

'The Interview' Synopsis: Dave Skylark and producer Aaron Rapoport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight." When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Un, they are recruited by the CIA to turn their trip to Pyongyang into an assassination mission.

'The Interview' has its share of hiccups. Firstly, the concept itself, would raise eye-brows & the sequences involving the dictator, are quite shocking, even though its told in all good humor. Performance-Wise: Rogen is in very good form, delivering above expectations. James Franco is a complete riot. Randall Park is another topper as the megalomaniac dictator. His scenes with Franco, are truly funny. Diana Bang is stupendous, she unknowingly steals the show!

When they discover that North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un is a fan of the show, they land an interview with him in an attempt to legitimize themselves as journalists. As Dave and Aaron prepare to travel to Pyongyang, their plans change when the CIA recruits them, perhaps the two least-qualified men imaginable, to assassinate Kim Jong-un.","datePublished":"2014-12-24","description":"Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapaport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight". When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Jong-Un Kim, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him.","keywords":"finger bitten off,assassination attempt,male nudity,dictator,alternate history","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2788710/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1","dateCreated":"2014-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some Wicked Fun!","reviewBody":"Despite the doomed controversy surrounding it, 'The Interview' is a pretty cool & funny film, that deserved a wider release. Its limited release may restrict its appeal, but I'd suggest anyone who wants to laugh on Christmas, should check this one out. 

'The Interview' Synopsis: Dave Skylark and producer Aaron Rapoport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight." When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Un, they are recruited by the CIA to turn their trip to Pyongyang into an assassination mission.

'The Interview' has its share of hiccups. Firstly, the concept itself, would raise eye-brows & the sequences involving the dictator, are quite shocking, even though its told in all good humor. One more thing, the excessive violence in the narrative puts off you. The bloodshed could've easily been calmer.

But on the plus side, 'The Interview' is quite a joyride! Seth Rogen's Story, is nicely complimented by a mostly laugh-out-loud Screenplay Written by Dan Sterling. There are moments of pure hilarity, as well as moments involving shocking dialogue. Rogen & Evan Goldberg's Direction is perfect. Cinematography is awesome. Editing is rightly done. Art Design is excellent. 

Performance-Wise: Rogen is in very good form, delivering above expectations. James Franco is a complete riot. His over-the-top, loud performance as the self-obsessed TV-Anchor, brings the house down on numerous occasions. Lizzy Caplan is first-rate. Randall Park is another topper as the megalomaniac dictator. His scenes with Franco, are truly funny. Diana Bang is stupendous, she unknowingly steals the show!

On the whole, 'The Interview' has moments of shock & gore, but there is also a lot of humor in here, that does the trick.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":311443,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent="

Lately, it seems JimmyÂ’s only solace can be found at the bottom of a whiskey glass. But when JimmyÂ’s estranged son, Mike (Joel Kinnaman), becomes a target, Jimmy must make a choice between the crime family he chose and the real family he abandoned long ago. I'm Very Impressed","reviewBody":"I went to see this because I found out last minute that "It Follows" was only limited release and I'M GLAD I DID! When you go see "Taken 2" or "Walk Among the Tombstones" you expect crazy action which you definitely get with Run All Night. But what you're not expecting is above average story and acting. There was great suspense with solid characters that you start to care about. There's some larger than life feats that Liam pulls off as usual, but it's done well.

Giving it a 9 out of 10 might be a little high, but I feel it deserves bonus points for surprising the heck out of me and breaking the recent trend of over the top Liam movies.

When you go see "Taken 2" or "Walk Among the Tombstones" you expect crazy action which you definitely get with Run All Night. But what you're not expecting is above average story and acting. Longtime best friend of mob boss Shawn Maguire (Ed Harris), Jimmy, now 55, is haunted by the sins of his pastÂ—as well as a dogged police detective whoÂ’s been one step behind Jimmy for 30 years. Lately, it seems JimmyÂ’s only solace can be found at the bottom of a whiskey glass. But when JimmyÂ’s estranged son, Mike (Joel Kinnaman), becomes a target, Jimmy must make a choice between the crime family he chose and the real family he abandoned long ago. With Mike on the run, JimmyÂ’s only penance for his past mistakes may be to keep his son from the same fate Jimmy is certain heÂ’ll face himselfÂ…at the wrong end of a gun. Now, with nowhere safe to turn, Jimmy just has one night to figure out exactly where his loyalties lie and to see if he can finally make things right. ","datePublished":"2015-03-25","description":"Mobster and hit man Jimmy Conlon has one night to figure out where his loyalties lie: with his estranged son, Mike, whose life is in danger, or his longtime best friend, mob boss Shawn Maguire, who wants Mike to pay for the death of ","keywords":"redemption,father son estrangement,aerial camera shot,movie flop,cigarette","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2199571/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"poopiter","dateCreated":"2015-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not Your Run Of The Mill Liam Movie.... I'm Very Impressed","reviewBody":"I went to see this because I found out last minute that "It Follows" was only limited release and I'M GLAD I DID! When you go see "Taken 2" or "Walk Among the Tombstones" you expect crazy action which you definitely get with Run All Night. But what you're not expecting is above average story and acting. There was great suspense with solid characters that you start to care about. There's some larger than life feats that Liam pulls off as usual, but it's done well.

Giving it a 9 out of 10 might be a little high, but I feel it deserves bonus points for surprising the heck out of me and breaking the recent trend of over the top Liam movies.

Don't wait for video on this one; it's a wild ride for the theater.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104568,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Legend of Hercules
Herkul
programme.desc:
The Legend of Hercules: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Kellan Lutz, Gaia Weiss, Scott Adkins, Roxanne McKee. The origin story of the mythical Greek hero. Betrayed by his stepfather, the King, and exiled and sold into slavery because of a forbidden love, Hercules must use his formidable powers to fight his way back to his rightful kingdom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1043726/","name":"The Legend of Hercules","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjEyODQxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQxMjE3MDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1553725/","name":"Kellan Lutz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4719349/","name":"Gaia Weiss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012078/","name":"Scott Adkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0248798/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393517/","name":"Sean Hood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316417/","name":"Daniel Giat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1685301273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzkyMzc2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI3MjAzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxMzkyMzc2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI3MjAzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":" The origin story of the the mythical Greek hero. Betrayed by his stepfather, the King, and exiled and sold into slavery because of a forbidden love, Hercules must use his formidable powers to fight his way back to his rightful kingdom. "},"datePublished":"2014-01-10","description":"The origin story of the mythical Greek hero. Betrayed by his stepfather, the King, and exiled and sold into slavery because of a forbidden love, Hercules must use his formidable powers to fight his way back to his rightful kingdom.","keywords":"ancient greece,hercules character,greece,psychotronic film,reference to zeus the greek deity","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1043726/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"drojan"},"dateCreated":"2014-01-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Eddie Murphy did a better Hercules than this","reviewBody":"Let me start off by saying I am a huge fantasy fan. I can usually enjoy any swords and sorcery type film and find something good about it. Now let me say Wow this movie was bad. I mean I thought this kind of clumsy, lowest common denominator filmmaking died in the 80's. It is bad when I asked the organizer to give me a refund on a free prescreening.

Where to begin? I don't expect much in this type of movie in terms of plot or characterization. In action "porn" like this, the plot is usually just barely coherent enough to move from one action sequence to the next and the characters are as black and white as a chessboard. This movie somehow delivers LESS than that.

It is staggering to me that with a mythology as rich and engaging to draw from, they choose a tired rehashing of Gladiator as the main focus of the film. No doubt holding the more interesting material back for future sequels. The laughable love story is unengaging, poorly scripted and given far too much screen time.

What really disappoints is the action sequences. Hercules is supposed to be a demigod that achieves the impossible; the movie portrays none of this. It wastes a good deal of time with a clumsy mix of fighting scenes in which Hercules is repeatedly captured and/or defeated. WTF? It is only towards the end that an attempt is made to show Hercules as he should be seen, but I had tuned out long before then. 

Oddly enough, the blood and gore in this film is kept to a minimum, probably to keep it at PG-13 in hopes of duping the largest possible audience to drop money on it. It would have really benefited from a Conan-esque level of violence to give the movie more weight and better directed action sequences. The dramatic pause in the middle of the action (made famous in the movie 300) is in every single action sequence. 

I really don't know what I recommend from this film. Everything in the movie has been done better in other films. I hope this film tanks but I doubt it. It will make a profit and encourage more of the same I'm sure."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

The Secret Life of Bees: Directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood. With Dakota Fanning, Queen Latifah, Jennifer Hudson, Alicia Keys. In 1964, a teenage girl in search of the truth about her mother runs away to a small town in South Carolina and finds a family of independent women who can connect her to her past." child","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0416212/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael11391"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Secret Life Of Bees is a powerful, amazing & excellent film followed by strong performances.","reviewBody":"Let me just say that the movie NEVER had dull moment or even a second in the ENTIRE film!!! Set in South Carolina 1964, Lily Owens (Dakota Fanning) who is haunted by the memory of her late mother, tries to escape her lonely life and bad relationship with her father (Paul Bettany), to get past her horrible incident with her late mother. So, she and her caregiver Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson) flees to a South Carolina town where it holds the secret of her mother's past. Lily and Rosaleen finds the intelligent Boatwright sisters: August (Queen Latifah), June (Alicia Keys and May (Sophie Okenendo) where they take Lily and Rosaleen in, to have a place to stay for a while.

The Secret Life Of Bees is a movie of what you call a "tearjerker" and that's what it is, the movie will touch your heart and teaches you about life, care, love & forget about your horrible past and move on. As for performances, everyone delivers and a couple of Oscar-worthy ones too. Dakota Fanning and Sophie Okenendo are the ones that delivers the Oscar-worthy performances. Come Oscars season, don't be surprised if any of those both actresses will be in the envelope (they deserved to get those nods!!) Queen Latifah, Alicia Keys and Jennifer Hudson (R.I.P her brother and mother who just passed away one day ago.) delivered their best performances yet even Jennifer (I thought this was her best performance yet and better than ever Oscar-winning performance in Dreamgirls.). As for the supporting actors: Bettany, Parker and Wilds, they did great as well.

The Secret Life Of Bees is one of this year's best films, rush out and buy a ticket for this wonderful and amazing film!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Predsjednikove boje
programme.desc: Priča prati demokratskog predsjedničkog kandidata, guvernera Jacka Stantona (J. Travolta), od početaka njegove kampanje do suočavanja s izravnim oponentom u finalu. Priča prati demokratskog predsjedničkog kandidata, guvernera Jacka Stantona (J. Travolta), od početaka njegove kampanje do suočavanja s izravnim oponentom u finalu. Karizmatična ličnost, Stanton lako zadobiva povjerenje glasača zbog svog ležernog, opuštenoga stava i osvježavajuće otvorena i iskrena pristupa. Šarmer je koji zna slušati i brinuti se o svojim ljudima. No, Stanton ima i mnoštvo "prljavog rublja" koje treba sakriti, zbog Stantonove poznate slabosti prema ženama. Njegova supruga Susan (E. Thompson) sve zna, ali podržava i brani supruga. Radnja je međutim viđena očima Henryja Burtona (A. Lester), mladog crnca, inače unuka poznatog borca za ljudska prava, koji je stalno rastrgan između politike i idealizma...

credits.actor: Kathleen Quinlan, Val Kilmer, Michael Wincott, Michael Madsen, Josh Evans, Billy Idol, Meg Ryan

mother runs away to a small town in South Carolina and finds a family of independent women who can connect her to her past.","keywords":"insect in title,f rated,racism,cake,neglected child","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0416212/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michael11391"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Secret Life Of Bees is a powerful, amazing & excellent film followed by strong performances.","reviewBody":"Let me just say that the movie NEVER had dull moment or even a second in the ENTIRE film!!! Set in South Carolina 1964, Lily Owens (Dakota Fanning) who is haunted by the memory of her late mother, tries to escape her lonely life and bad relationship with her father (Paul Bettany), to get past her horrible incident with her late mother. So, she and her caregiver Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson) flees to a South Carolina town where it holds the secret of her mother's past. Lily and Rosaleen finds the intelligent Boatwright sisters: August (Queen Latifah), June (Alicia Keys and May (Sophie Okenendo) where they take Lily and Rosaleen in, to have a place to stay for a while.

The Secret Life Of Bees is a movie of what you call a "tearjerker" and that's what it is, the movie will touch your heart and teaches you about life, care, love & forget about your horrible past and move on. As for performances, everyone delivers and a couple of Oscar-worthy ones too. Dakota Fanning and Sophie Okenendo are the ones that delivers the Oscar-worthy performances. Come Oscars season, don't be surprised if any of those both actresses will be in the envelope (they deserved to get those nods!!) Queen Latifah, Alicia Keys and Jennifer Hudson (R.I.P her brother and mother who just passed away one day ago.) delivered their best performances yet even Jennifer (I thought this was her best performance yet and better than ever Oscar-winning performance in Dreamgirls.). As for the supporting actors: Bettany, Parker and Wilds, they did great as well.

The Secret Life Of Bees is one of this year's best films, rush out and buy a ticket for this wonderful and amazing film!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection

Hot Shots! Part Deux: Directed by Jim Abrahams. With Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Richard Crenna. "Rambo" parody in which Topper Harley leads a rescue team into Iraq to save Iraqi war prisoners and all of their previous rescue teams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107144/","name":"Hot Shots! Part Deux","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU2ODlmZWMtODEwZS00NTQ0LTk1ZDYtYzk0ZjE3ZGZhMGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000221/","name":"Charlie Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000978/","name":"Lloyd Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000420/","name":"Valeria Golino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000720/","name":"Jim Abrahams"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000720/","name":"Jim Abrahams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Shots! Part Deux","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3197736985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWFmMWM4ZmMtYzU5MC00NGIwLWIwZTQtMTkwNTUxN2VhOGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWFmMWM4ZmMtYzU5MC00NGIwLWIwZTQtMTkwNTUxN2VhOGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Hot Shots! Part Deux"},"datePublished":"1993-05-21","description":""Rambo" parody in which Topper Harley leads a rescue team into Iraq to save Iraqi war prisoners and all of their previous rescue teams.","keywords":"male objectification,parody,bare midriff,limousine driver,rambo","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107144/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheUnknown837-1"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"precisely the sort of comedy that a movie-lover like myself enjoys","reviewBody":"I don't know if I've ever seen a comedy as zany or as randomly silly as "Hot Shots! Part Deux." Then again, I'm not all that familiar with the comedy genre, but I can say that between this movie and its predecessor, every pratfall, every parody, every little joke has been done. Part Deux is even crazier and more random than its nonsensically silly prequel and it's even less intelligent, but strangely enough, it's a lot more enjoyable. I thought the first "Hot Shots!" was a promising hit-and-miss satire; Part Deux succeeds.

Like its predecessor, Part Deux sets its plot as a parody of one specific film, but makes satirical parodies of dozens throughout its running time. The first movie was a parody of "Top Gun" but made references to dozens of other movies from "Dances With Wolves" to "Gone with the Wind." Likewise, the sequel is a parody of "Rambo III", but that's just the setup for all of the jokes that follow. Like Rambo, Topper Harley (Charlie Sheen) is retired to the Far East when his former commander (Richard Crenna) comes in and asks him to join a rescue mission to save hostages from Iraqi captors. Sheen at first refuses but when Crenna is captured as he was in "Rambo III", Sheen heads in after him along with a misfit group of soldiers. And meanwhile, Admiral Benson (Lloyd Bridges) from the first movie has been promoted to president of the United States and continues his idiotic and incompetent running of the country.

Now this is precisely the sort of comedy that a movie-lover like myself enjoys. Why? Well, not only because it is so zany and buffoonish that one can't help but laugh at it, but because it's like a big mincemeat of movie references. The setup is a parody of "Rambo III", but I spotted parodies of "Casablanca", "Platoon" (which also starred Charlie Sheen), "Lady and the Tramp", "The Wizard of Oz", "Terminator 2" and so on. And just when I thought they were going to between two movies forget to parody "Star Wars", sure enough I got my fix for that. And that's not even the limit of it. The movie also makes jokes and points fingers at some of your favorite actors. A brief example is an enemy patrol boat that comes into the shot. The boat's name is "The Behn Gazaarah" as a tribute to actor Ben Gazzara. If you've seen lots of movies and you love the movies, this is the comedy for you because you can sit back, relax, have the time of your life laughing, and point your finger at the screen whenever a parody comes up and say "Yeah, that was from (insert movie title)!" "Hot Shots! Part Deux" opens up with a joke and closes with a joke and at least ninety percent of these are gut-busting in their effect. There are some jokes throughout the film, such as a few of the Saddam Hussein jokes toward the beginning, that were not all that funny, but around and after that were some of the zaniest, silliest, most random pratfalls I've ever seen. But it's also funny because it doesn't just make a simple parody and joke, but keeps pushing it one step ahead. Instead of just simply parodying the spaghetti-kiss scene from "Lady and the Tramp", it carries it to the next step with Charlie Sheen pushing a meatball across the plate with his nose and then the scene morphs in a parody of "Casablanca." It's also not just enough for the movie to create a character like Richard Crenna's character in the Rambo series to be Sheen's former commanding officer. But to have Richard Crenna himself play the character and wear the same outfit and the same makeup and speak in the same rhythm and manner.

And if there is one other element in this movie that I loved, it was the Lloyd Bridges character. Like the admiral he played in the first "Hot Shots!" Bridges plays the president of the United States, Thomas "Tug" Benson as simply a complete idiot, somebody so stupid that they could never, in real life, get a job running a grocery store let alone a country. And Bridges looks like he's having a good time playing the character, which in turn makes it very funny for the audience.

In closing, "Hot Shots! Part Deux" is a tremendously enjoyable satirical comedy and precisely the sort of parody that I find entertaining. The key to its success is that it's so unbelievably random and silly and nonsensical. Whereas so many comedies I know try to do the same thing but just fail, it passes with flying colors. This is one funny movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
Veliki Gatsby
programme.desc: The Great Gatsby: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Lisa Adam, Frank Aldridge, Amitabh Bachchan, Steve Bisley. A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1343092/","name":"The Great Gatsby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNTk1ODcxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDI1OTMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1659547/","name":"Carey Mulligan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249291/","name":"Joel Edgerton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056790/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668902/","name":"Craig Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0280234/","name":"F. Scott Fitzgerald"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2949817881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Midwestern war veteran finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor. "},"datePublished":"2013-05-15","description":"A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.","keywords":"extramarital affair,obsessive love,party,dead body in swimming pool,fatal accident","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1343092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"laura-alter22"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loved it!","reviewBody":"For the record, I've read Gatsby at least every other year since I was 17, so, believe me when I say I have been counting down the days and minutes until the new movie opened.\n\nHere it goes then, I saw Gatsby last night and......absolutely loved it! In retrospect (as in halfway through the movie), it just clicked, Leonardo was perfect. He wasn't Redford, but in my humble opinion, better! He nailed it, portraying Gatsby as this truly multi-dimensional character. At first, we're introduced to Gatsby, the well-rehearsed old sport telling his canned story about studying at Oxford, Montenegro medals, etc. etc., but then slowly that forced veneer peels away, and he gives us this angsty, desperate, so-happy-in-love, we can remake the past, tortured soul. Much, much better than Redford. And, the same goes with Daisy. Mia Farrow's Daisy was all flighty and light as a feather, pretty pathetic and self-absorbed, you wonder, what's the big deal with this woman who everyone loves....but with Carey Mulligan, you get it. The scenes of the two of them as young lovers explain it all. Finally, Tobey McGuire....I love him as Peter Parker, Homer Wells and now Nick Carraway. I thought the idea of having him author Gatsby from a hospital was very clever, allowed him to read long passages directly from the book. As for Jay-Z et al., I really didn't mind it, as far as I was concerned, it didn't distract and certainly worked to illuminate the frenetic energy of the 20's. Please, give it another try, see it again. From my experience, a Baz Luhrmann movie is always better the second time around (Moulin Rogue).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":492933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

","datePublished":"2013-05-15","description":"A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.","keywords":"extramarital affair,obsessive love,party,dead body in swimming pool,fatal accident","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1343092/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"laura-alter22","dateCreated":"2013-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loved it!","reviewBody":"For the record, I've read Gatsby at least every other year since I was 17, so, believe me when I say I have been counting down the days and minutes until the new movie opened.\n\nHere it goes then, I saw Gatsby last night and......absolutely loved it! In retrospect (as in halfway through the movie), it just clicked, Leonardo was perfect. He wasn't Redford, but in my humble opinion, better! He nailed it, portraying Gatsby as this truly multi-dimensional character. At first, we're introduced to Gatsby, the well-rehearsed old sport telling his canned story about studying at Oxford, Montenegro medals, etc. etc., but then slowly that forced veneer peels away, and he gives us this angsty, desperate, so-happy-in-love, we can remake the past, tortured soul. Much, much better than Redford. And, the same goes with Daisy. Mia Farrow's Daisy was all flighty and light as a feather, pretty pathetic and self-absorbed, you wonder, what's the big deal with this woman who everyone loves....but with Carey Mulligan, you get it. Please, give it another try, see it again. will be a great crowd pleaser","reviewBody":"Even though An Officer and a Gentleman came out when I was a year old I still recall seeing the film on video when I was about four or five because my mother is a huge Richard Gere fan. An Officer and a Gentleman is a classic tale of overcoming yourself, beating the odds, friendship and the all amercian love story. The film which to this day Taylor Hackford has never topped gets great performances out of all it's actors especially Gere and Debra Winger as the two love birds in love and the odds they over come to be together. The film doesn't make training look unrealstic or promosing and of course there's going to be errors in the film's deception of the miltray but what film about the miltray has been perfect through out ? What makes An Officer and a Gentleman work for me is the performances and we all know that even though Gere and Winger give great performances the film belongs to Louis Gosset Jr who won a well deserved Oscar for his role as Foley. The difference between Gosset and R. Lee Emery in Full Metal Jacket is Emery was a former gunnery sergerant in the Marines and Gosset never had milatry experince to my knowledge which makes the film all the more enjoyable. Throw in some comedy, a few fight scenes and some sex scenes and you have a great crowd pleasing film that anyone can enjoy. I give the film **** stars."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51191,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Barska mušica
programme.desc: Henri (Miki Rurk) se upoznaje sa izgnanicom iz društva, Vandom Vilkoks (Fej Danavej), koja vodi sličan život njegovom i za koju se priča daje luda. Oni se zaljubljuju i počinju da žive zajedno, bez... Henri (Miki Rurk) se upoznaje sa izgnanicom iz društva, Vandom Vilkoks (Fej Danavej), koja vodi sličan život njegovom i za koju se priča daje luda. Oni se zaljubljuju i počinju da žive zajedno, bez obzira na to što je sasvim jasno da bi Vanda uradila sve ukoliko joj neko plati turu pića. Henri će biti u prilici da sredi svoj život kada dobije ponudu da za veliku proviziju izda svoj roman.

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
Kakvi frajeri! 2
programme.desc:
Hot Shots! Part Deux: Directed by Jim Abrahams. With Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Richard Crenna. "Rambo" parody in which Topper Harley leads a rescue team into Iraq to save Iraqi war prisoners and all of their previous rescue teams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107144/","name":"Hot Shots! Part Deux","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU2ODlmZWMtODEwZS00NTQ0LTk1ZDYtYzk0ZjE3ZGZhMGM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000221/","name":"Charlie Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000978/","name":"Lloyd Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000420/","name":"Valeria Golino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000720/","name":"Jim Abrahams"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000720/","name":"Jim Abrahams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hot Shots! Part Deux","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3197736985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWFmMWM4ZmMtYzU5MC00NGIwLWIwZTQtMTkwNTUxN2VhOGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWFmMWM4ZmMtYzU5MC00NGIwLWIwZTQtMTkwNTUxN2VhOGZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Hot Shots! Part Deux"},"datePublished":"1993-05-21","description":""Rambo" parody in which Topper Harley leads a rescue team into Iraq to save Iraqi war prisoners and all of their previous rescue teams.","keywords":"male objectification,parody,bare midriff,limousine driver,rambo","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107144/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheUnknown837-1"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"precisely the sort of comedy that a movie-lover like myself enjoys","reviewBody":"I don't know if I've ever seen a comedy as zany or as randomly silly as "Hot Shots! Part Deux." Then again, I'm not all that familiar with the comedy genre, but I can say that between this movie and its predecessor, every pratfall, every parody, every little joke has been done. Part Deux is even crazier and more random than its nonsensically silly prequel and it's even less intelligent, but strangely enough, it's a lot more enjoyable. I thought the first "Hot Shots!" was a promising hit-and-miss satire; Part Deux succeeds.

Like its predecessor, Part Deux sets its plot as a parody of one specific film, but makes satirical parodies of dozens throughout its running time. The first movie was a parody of "Top Gun" but made references to dozens of other movies from "Dances With Wolves" to "Gone with the Wind." Likewise, the sequel is a parody of "Rambo III", but that's just the setup for all of the jokes that follow. Like Rambo, Topper Harley (Charlie Sheen) is retired to the Far East when his former commander (Richard Crenna) comes in and asks him to join a rescue mission to save hostages from Iraqi captors. Sheen at first refuses but when Crenna is captured as he was in "Rambo III", Sheen heads in after him along with a misfit group of soldiers. And meanwhile, Admiral Benson (Lloyd Bridges) from the first movie has been promoted to president of the United States and continues his idiotic and incompetent running of the country.

Now this is precisely the sort of comedy that a movie-lover like myself enjoys. Why? Well, not only because it is so zany and buffoonish that one can't help but laugh at it, but because it's like a big mincemeat of movie references. The setup is a parody of "Rambo III", but I spotted parodies of "Casablanca", "Platoon" (which also starred Charlie Sheen), "Lady and the Tramp", "The Wizard of Oz", "Terminator 2" and so on. And just when I thought they were going to between two movies forget to parody "Star Wars", sure enough I got my fix for that. And that's not even the limit of it. The movie also makes jokes and points fingers at some of your favorite actors. A brief example is an enemy patrol boat that comes into the shot. The boat's name is "The Behn Gazaarah" as a tribute to actor Ben Gazzara. If you've seen lots of movies and you love the movies, this is the comedy for you because you can sit back, relax, have the time of your life laughing, and point your finger at the screen whenever a parody comes up and say "Yeah, that was from (insert movie title)!" "Hot Shots! Part Deux" opens up with a joke and closes with a joke and at least ninety percent of these are gut-busting in their effect. There are some jokes throughout the film, such as a few of the Saddam Hussein jokes toward the beginning, that were not all that funny, but around and after that were some of the zaniest, silliest, most random pratfalls I've ever seen. But it's also funny because it doesn't just make a simple parody and joke, but keeps pushing it one step ahead. Instead of just simply parodying the spaghetti-kiss scene from "Lady and the Tramp", it carries it to the next step with Charlie Sheen pushing a meatball across the plate with his nose and then the scene morphs in a parody of "Casablanca." It's also not just enough for the movie to create a character like Richard Crenna's character in the Rambo series to be Sheen's former commanding officer. But to have Richard Crenna himself play the character and wear the same outfit and the same makeup and speak in the same rhythm and manner.

And if there is one other element in this movie that I loved, it was the Lloyd Bridges character. Like the admiral he played in the first "Hot Shots!" Bridges plays the president of the United States, Thomas "Tug" Benson as simply a complete idiot, somebody so stupid that they could never, in real life, get a job running a grocery store let alone a country. And Bridges looks like he's having a good time playing the character, which in turn makes it very funny for the audience.

In closing, "Hot Shots! Part Deux" is a tremendously enjoyable satirical comedy and precisely the sort of parody that I find entertaining. The key to its success is that it's so unbelievably random and silly and nonsensical. Whereas so many comedies I know try to do the same thing but just fail, it passes with flying colors. This is one funny movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Great Gatsby
Veliki Gatsby
programme.desc: The Great Gatsby: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Lisa Adam, Frank Aldridge, Amitabh Bachchan, Steve Bisley. A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1343092/","name":"The Great Gatsby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNTk1ODcxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDI1OTMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1659547/","name":"Carey Mulligan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249291/","name":"Joel Edgerton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056790/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668902/","name":"Craig Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0280234/","name":"F. Scott Fitzgerald"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2949817881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Midwestern war veteran finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor. "},"datePublished":"2013-05-15","description":"A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.","keywords":"extramarital affair,obsessive love,party,dead body in swimming pool,fatal accident","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1343092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"laura-alter22"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loved it!","reviewBody":"For the record, I've read Gatsby at least every other year since I was 17, so, believe me when I say I have been counting down the days and minutes until the new movie opened.\n\nHere it goes then, I saw Gatsby last night and......absolutely loved it! In retrospect (as in halfway through the movie), it just clicked, Leonardo was perfect. He wasn't Redford, but in my humble opinion, better! He nailed it, portraying Gatsby as this truly multi-dimensional character. At first, we're introduced to Gatsby, the well-rehearsed old sport telling his canned story about studying at Oxford, Montenegro medals, etc. etc., but then slowly that forced veneer peels away, and he gives us this angsty, desperate, so-happy-in-love, we can remake the past, tortured soul. Much, much better than Redford. And, the same goes with Daisy. Mia Farrow's Daisy was all flighty and light as a feather, pretty pathetic and self-absorbed, you wonder, what's the big deal with this woman who everyone loves....but with Carey Mulligan, you get it. The scenes of the two of them as young lovers explain it all. Finally, Tobey McGuire....I love him as Peter Parker, Homer Wells and now Nick Carraway. I thought the idea of having him author Gatsby from a hospital was very clever, allowed him to read long passages directly from the book. As for Jay-Z et al., I really didn't mind it, as far as I was concerned, it didn't distract and certainly worked to illuminate the frenetic energy of the 20's. Please, give it another try, see it again. From my experience, a Baz Luhrmann movie is always better the second time around (Moulin Rogue).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":492933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1343092, Title: The Great Gatsby, --- Description: The Great Gatsby: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Lisa Adam, Frank Aldridge, Amitabh Bachchan, Steve Bisley. A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1343092/","name":"The Great Gatsby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNTk1ODcxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDI1OTMzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1659547/","name":"Carey Mulligan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249291/","name":"Joel Edgerton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056790/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668902/","name":"Craig Pearce","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0280234/","name":"F. Scott Fitzgerald"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2949817881","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1ODU0Njg4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzY2MTYzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Midwestern war veteran finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor. ","datePublished":"2013-05-15","description":"A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.","keywords":"extramarital affair,obsessive love,party,dead body in swimming pool,fatal accident","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1343092/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"laura-alter22","dateCreated":"2013-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loved it!","reviewBody":"For the record, I've read Gatsby at least every other year since I was 17, so, believe me when I say I have been counting down the days and minutes until the new movie opened.\n\nHere it goes then, I saw Gatsby last night and......absolutely loved it! In retrospect (as in halfway through the movie), it just clicked, Leonardo was perfect. He wasn't Redford, but in my humble opinion, better! He nailed it, portraying Gatsby as this truly multi-dimensional character. At first, we're introduced to Gatsby, the well-rehearsed old sport telling his canned story about studying at Oxford, Montenegro medals, etc. etc., but then slowly that forced veneer peels away, and he gives us this angsty, desperate, so-happy-in-love, we can remake the past, tortured soul. Much, much better than Redford. And, the same goes with Daisy. Mia Farrow's Daisy was all flighty and light as a feather, pretty pathetic and self-absorbed, you wonder, what's the big deal with this woman who everyone loves....but with Carey Mulligan, you get it. The scenes of the two of them as young lovers explain it all. Finally, Tobey McGuire....I love him as Peter Parker, Homer Wells and now Nick Carraway. I thought the idea of having him author Gatsby from a hospital was very clever, allowed him to read long passages directly from the book. As for Jay-Z et al., I really didn't mind it, as far as I was concerned, it didn't distract and certainly worked to illuminate the frenetic energy of the 20's. Please, give it another try, see it again. From my experience, a Baz Luhrmann movie is always better the second time around (Moulin Rogue).","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":492933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"duration":"PT2H23M"</script><metacontent="

uniform","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0084434/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DunnDeeDaGreat"},"dateCreated":"2003-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Always will be a great crowd pleaser","reviewBody":"Even though An Officer and a Gentleman came out when I was a year old I still recall seeing the film on video when I was about four or five because my mother is a huge Richard Gere fan. An Officer and a Gentleman is a classic tale of overcoming yourself, beating the odds, friendship and the all amercian love story. The film which to this day Taylor Hackford has never topped gets great performances out of all it's actors especially Gere and Debra Winger as the two love birds in love and the odds they over come to be together. The film doesn't make training look unrealstic or promosing and of course there's going to be errors in the film's deception of the miltray but what film about the miltray has been perfect through out ? What makes An Officer and a Gentleman work for me is the performances and we all know that even though Gere and Winger give great performances the film belongs to Louis Gosset Jr who won a well deserved Oscar for his role as Foley. The difference between Gosset and R. Lee Emery in Full Metal Jacket is Emery was a former gunnery sergerant in the Marines and Gosset never had milatry experince to my knowledge which makes the film all the more enjoyable. Throw in some comedy, a few fight scenes and some sex scenes and you have a great crowd pleasing film that anyone can enjoy. I give the film **** stars."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51191,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dad
Tata
programme.desc:
Dad: Directed by Gary David Goldberg. With Jack Lemmon, Ted Danson, Olympia Dukakis, Kathy Baker. While his mom recovers in hospital from a heart attack, John puts his busy life on hold to fly home and help his elderly dad around the house. John's son later joins them and they all truly bond for the first and, tragically, final time." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097142/","name":"Dad","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjcwOTE5MGMtNGU1ZC00M2RmLThlZjQtYzdiMTQ3MzY2MjQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE5MjUyOTM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000493/","name":"Jack Lemmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001101/","name":"Ted Danson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001156/","name":"Olympia Dukakis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325204/","name":"Gary David Goldberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060022/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0923607/","name":"William Wharton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325204/","name":"Gary David Goldberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dad","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1235222809","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc5OTM4NTktZDJjMy00MDYyLWE2M2YtYjhlNWM2OGVlNzZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc5OTM4NTktZDJjMy00MDYyLWE2M2YtYjhlNWM2OGVlNzZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"datePublished":"1989-11-10","description":"While his mom recovers in hospital from a heart attack, John puts his busy life on hold to fly home and help his elderly dad around the house. John's son later joins them and they all truly bond for the first and, tragically, final t","keywords":"heart attack,playing catch,coma,delusion,terminal illness","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097142/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wisewebwoman"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"this remains a powerful film","reviewBody":"I think this is Jack Lemmon's greatest performance and the supporting cast are incredible, including Ted Danson who always appears to me to be slightly frenetic in a grim kind of way. Here he is truly believable and his scenes with his own son tug at your heart they are so real. No Hollywood quickfix here for the relationship, the boy is simply closer to his grandfather than he is to his own father and nothing will change that fact.

What I liked most about the film was that the theme in less worthy hands could have been made sloppily sentimental, but here it is totally restrained both in script and direction and it makes for a really meaningful movie. The characters remain real all the way through and the script does not transform them into wondrous saints by movie's end.

It is the wonderful understatement in it all that captivated me and made me weep at the end. Jack is truly unforgettable and Olympia magnificent in her dryness and cynicism. I have seen it 3 times and each time relished another scene a little more. This time around it was Jack dragging his wife around to meet the neighbours he was not even aware of before and her long suffering face at this new and reinvented Jack makes you laugh out loud. Bravo to all. An 8 1/2 out of 10. And that scene where they dance, oh me oh my......who needs naked bodies writhing on a bed, this has sensuousness, love and intimacy in it, the real kind. Oh for more of those scenes in movies!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4664,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Grudge Match: Directed by Peter Segal. With Jim Lampley, Sylvester Stallone, Robert De Niro, Rich Little. A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout, thirty years after their last match." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1661382/","name":"Grudge Match","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjhhZDYxMmUtZWRiZC00MThiLWI4ZjgtM2M1YjhhNWRlZTQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwNDgzNjc@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000107/","name":"Kim Basinger"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781842/","name":"Peter Segal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113274/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062831/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0449458/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445552/","name":"Tim Kelleher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745247/","name":"Rodney Rothman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2557192473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMjg2MzUzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzg3NDMyMDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMjg2MzUzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzg3NDMyMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout -- 30 years after their last match. "},"datePublished":"2013-12-25","description":"A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout, thirty years after their last match.","keywords":"united states of america,usa,father son relationship,car,automobile","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1661382/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sharpobject2424"},"dateCreated":"2014-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Flick - Deserves Better","reviewBody":"Grudge Match is an entirely satisfying popcorn flick that is good for just about any kind of movie-goer. The laughs are thoughtful, consistent, and sometimes enormous. There are some genuinely side-splitting moments here. And it's not just laughs; the story is sincere and emotionally driven, with excellent acting across the board to bolster it. There are essentially two story lines here in parallel to each other that occasionally intertwine so the plot stays interesting, granting the movie a little more to offer than your usual comedy. The movie had heart and if you let it, Grudge Match will win you over. I don't want to go too much into detail because I really encourage viewers to go in and check it out for themselves. Bring your low expectations if that's what you have because it certainly doesn't hurt. ","datePublished":"2013-12-25","description":"A pair of aging boxing rivals are coaxed out of retirement to fight one final bout, thirty years after their last match.","keywords":"united states of america,usa,father son relationship,car,automobile","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1661382/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sharpobject2424","dateCreated":"2014-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Flick - Deserves Better","reviewBody":"Grudge Match is an entirely satisfying popcorn flick that is good for just about any kind of movie-goer. The laughs are thoughtful, consistent, and sometimes enormous. There are some genuinely side-splitting moments here. And it's not just laughs; the story is sincere and emotionally driven, with excellent acting across the board to bolster it. There are essentially two story lines here in parallel to each other that occasionally intertwine so the plot stays interesting, granting the movie a little more to offer than your usual comedy. The movie had heart and if you let it, Grudge Match will win you over. I don't want to go too much into detail because I really encourage viewers to go in and check it out for themselves. Bring your low expectations if that's what you have because it certainly doesn't hurt. I just can''t believe this movie is doing so poorly in the box office, because it was in the very least a solid film with everything executed right. Go see it, and if you like it then see it again because Grudge Match deserves a much better reputation than it's getting.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":58522,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"duration":"PT1H53M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Directed by Milorad Milinkovic. With Vojin Cetkovic, Tamara Garbajs, Zijah Sokolovic, Jelisaveta 'Seka' Sablic. Braća po materi
programme.desc: Braca po materi: Directed by Zdravko Sotra. With Zarko Lausevic, Slavko Stimac, Mira Furlan, Sonja Savic. This story about two maternal half-brothers, a Croat and a Serb. Although they never met, and both lose their loved ones in ethnic clashes, there is a bond between them. programme.desc: Directed by Slobodan Sijan. With Pavle Vuisic, Dragan Nikolic, Danilo 'Bata' Stojkovic, Aleksandar Bercek. It's April 5, 1941, somewhere in Serbia. A group of people go on a bus to Belgrade, on a journey that will change their lives forever.

programme.title: Nacionalna klasa
Nacionalna klasa
programme.desc: Nacionalna klasa: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Bogdan Diklic, Gorica Popovic, Rade Markovic. One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, avoiding his draft calls, and refusing to deal with any life responsibility in general. The decisive race on Saturday is only what he cares about." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079606/","name":"Nacionalna klasa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ3ZTFkYWItNTIxNC00ZGJlLTgyZWUtZmViNTgyNzRiNmE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226699/","name":"Bogdan Diklic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691419/","name":"Gorica Popovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"datePublished":"1979-01-09","description":"One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. The movie follows his attempts to avoid both the army and marriage in a matter of week, eventually failing in both. He usually drives around in his Zastava 750, sits at caffe's and takes no significant responsibilities. With a synopsis like this, the first film that comes to my mind is "Once Upon a Time There Was a Singing Blackbird", but this has much more comic input than Iosseliani's movie. Goran Markovic's masterpiece is one of the most beloved Serbian films of all time. It's more than a successful comedy. programme.title: Citulja za Eskobara
Čitulja za Eskobara
programme.desc: Directed by Milorad Milinkovic. With Vojin Cetkovic, Tamara Garbajs, Zijah Sokolovic, Jelisaveta 'Seka' Sablic. A comic look at Serbian criminal milieu, shown as a bunch of rude and primitive members deeply involved in organized crime which have its roots in their school days' friendship.
